intro: Blaeria meyeri-johannis, commonly known as the Meyer-Johanns blazer, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is also valued for its aromatic foliage, which can be used in culinary or medicinal applications.
